intro: Cyrilla fuscata, commonly known as the dark cyrilla, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Lythraceae family, which includes plants such as willows and pittosporums. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Cyrilla fuscata typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
